Testing Go Run!

  • exec: command to run - required
  • dir: directory to run the command in, defaults to current directory
  • hide-stdout: hide stdout output, defaults to false
  • hide-stderr: hide stderr output, defaults to false
  • hide-cmd: hide the command used to run the command, defaults to false

more text

As we can see from the output, the command failed.

$ go run -tags sad .

-------
STDERR:

boom!
exit status 255

-------
duration: 470.932264ms
go:       go1.17.3

even more output!

$ tree

.
|-- go.mod
|-- main.go
|-- print.go
`-- print_error.go

0 directories, 4 files

-------
duration: 4.976271ms

clean the pwd

$ echo hello

hello

-------
duration: 3.097656ms

skip stderr

$ go run main.go print.go

-------
STDERR:

stderr-> Hello, Error!

-------
duration: 487.308985ms
go:       go1.17.3

As we can see from the output, the command was executed successfully.

stdout-> Hello, World!

-------
STDERR:

stderr-> Hello, Error!

-------
duration: 511.612859ms
go:       go1.17.3

run a command

$ go run .
